bibl.title: Jow Mun Fuey v. Luther Weedin. Order to Show Cause
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Matter of the Application of Jow Mun Fuey for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

The above named petitioner having made application to this court for a Writ of Habeas Corpus addressed to the United States Commissioner of Immigration Luther Weedin, and to such persons or agents acting by, through or under him, or in behalf of the United States Government, in whose custody the petitioner is shown by his petition to be confined and restrained of his liberty as alleged in his said petition illegally and unwarranted, and without power or authority of law and not under virtue of or by power or authority of the statutes of the United States; and the court being fully advised in the premises;

IT IS ORDERED That the Commissioner of Immigration in charge of the Immigration Station and Detention House at Seattle, or such persons acting under or in behalf of said Commissioner, or the United States Government, having custody of said Jow Mun Fuey, show cause before this court at the Court Room in the Federal Building in the City of Seattle, on the 9th day of January, 1922, at 10 o'clock in the forenoon of said day, why said application should not be granted, and in the mean time you, the said Commissioner of Immigration Luther Weedin, in charge of the Immigration and Detention Station at Seattle, Wash- ington, as well as said persons who are acting under and through you in behalf of the United States Government, refrain and desist from deporting said Jow Mun Fuey from said District, or carrying
into effect any warrant or order for his deportation which may be held by you, or either of you.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED That a certified copy of this order shall be served on the United States Commissioner in charge of the United States Immigration Station at Seattle, or on such Government official in charge of said Joy mun Fuey as sufficient authority for the above instruction.
The within is a full true and correct copy of an original writ this day issued.
WITNESS my hand and official seal this 5 day of June 1922
